newsitem.title: BELGIUM: No change to EMU timing, criteria - EU's de Silguy.
newsitem.headline: No change to EMU timing, criteria - EU's de Silguy.

text.p: European Commissioner Yves-Thibault de Silguy strongly rejected on Thursday speculation that the start of economic and monetary union could be delayed or that the criteria for entry could be changed.
"There is no question about changing the criteria or changing the date," de Silguy told a briefing with Swedish journalists.
De Silguy, who will visit Stockholm on Friday, also said he expected several countries to be ready for monetary union.
He referred to a Commission forecast last November projecting EU growth at 2.3 percent for 1997 and said there was no reason to believe that the figure would be lower.

De Silguy said the only way of delaying EMU would be to change the EU treaty but that this could cause legal disputes, be negative for Europe's credibility and also open the door for pressure groups in all member states regarding national budgets. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
